message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DS

This paper is about sequence tagging, which is a core task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of deep learning models, which suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a Bayesian method for aggregating sequence labels, which falls under the category of probabilistic modeling and inference, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. The paper also evaluates its method on named entity recognition and information extraction tasks, which are common in information retrieval (IR) and data science (DS), respectively, making cs.IR and cs.DS possible sub-categories as well.
